text: Edoardo Vesentini (31 May 1928 – 28 March 2020) was an Italian mathematician and politician. He helped introduce the Andreotti–Vesentini theorem. He was awarded the Caccioppoli Prize in 1962. He was the director of the Scuola Normale Superiore di Pisa from 1978 to 1987. He also served as a Senator between 1987 and 1992. He was born in Rome. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Vasentini died in Pisa on 28 March 2020. He was 91. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Italian academics Category:Italian mathematicians Category:Politicians from Rome Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: Edoardo Vesentini
